Interfaces

Interface Register

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote

    public interface Register
extends java.rmi.Remote
    This data type defines the operational interface of a remote object of type RegisterRemoteObject. It provides the functionality to register remote objects in the local registry service.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bind(java.lang.String name, java.rmi.Remote ref)
      Binds a remote reference to the specified name in this registry.
      void rebind(java.lang.String name, java.rmi.Remote ref)
      Replaces the binding for the specified name in this registry with the supplied remote reference.
      void unbind(java.lang.String name)
      Removes the binding for the specified name in this registry.

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        void bind(java.lang.String name,
          java.rmi.Remote ref)
   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
          java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException
        Binds a remote reference to the specified name in this registry.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to associate with the remote reference
        ref - reference to the remote object
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if either the invocation of the remote method, or the communication with the registry service fails
        java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException - if the name is already in use

      • unbind

        void unbind(java.lang.String name)
     throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
            java.rmi.NotBoundException
        Removes the binding for the specified name in this registry.
        Parameters:
        name - the name associated with the remote reference
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if either the invocation of the remote method, or the communication with the registry service fails
        java.rmi.NotBoundException - if the name is not in use

      • rebind

        void rebind(java.lang.String name,
            java.rmi.Remote ref)
     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Replaces the binding for the specified name in this registry with the supplied remote reference. If a previous binding for the specified name exists, it is discarded.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to associate with the remote reference
        ref - reference to the remote object
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if either the invocation of the remote method, or the communication with the registry service fails
